column1: #Text=Aggregate Crepe Ratio=Transfer cylinder speed.div.Reel speed, and
#Text=[0114] The Aggregate Crepe, expressed as a percent, is indicative of the final MD stretch found in sheets made with this process.
#Text=The contributions to that overall MD stretch can be broken down into the two major creping components, fabric and reel creping, by using the ratio values.
#Text=For example, if the transfer cylinder speed is 5000 fpm, the creping fabric speed is 4000 fpm and the reel is 3600 fpm, then the following values are obtained:
#Text=1 Aggregate Crepe Ratio 5000/3600 = 1.39 (39%) Fabric Creping Ratio 5000/4000 = 1.25 (25%) Reel Creping Ratio 4000/3600 = 1.11 (11%)
#Text=[0115] PLI or pli means pounds force per linear inch.
